messages.original: Donald Trump has released a statement claiming to have captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife.
This could be what the earlier reported U.S. delta force landings in Caracas were for.
According to unconfirmed reports, Caracas International Airport is under U.S. control and ready to accept transport aircraft.
Kh-59/69 cruise missile to Krasnopillya, Sumy Oblast.
Kh-59/69 cruise missile to Krasnopillya, Sumy Oblast.

Flying to Okhtyrka and then Poltava Oblast on a southwestern course.
It was launched from a Su-34 over eastern Kursk Oblast.
Changed course to the west and entered Poltava Oblast, flying in the direction of Hadyach. It will probably bypass Hadyach from the south.

The missile is flying low, repeatedly disappearing from radars. 
A Su-57 also carried out a launch maneuver from eastern Kursk Oblast around 5 mins ago, however this was likely simulated with electronic warfare.

The Kh-59/69 flew south of Hadyach and changed course to the southwest, flying towards Lubny, Poltava Oblast.
For now the height is about 100 metres.
The target is likely Kaniv, Cherkasy Oblast.
Changed course to the west again, flying to Hrebinka.
Changed course to the west again, flying to Hrebinka.
Maneuvering north of Lubny, Poltava Oblast, constantly changing course.
Now maneuvering south of Hrebinka, Poltava Oblast, generally flying towards Drabiv, Cherkasy Oblast.
Now flying southwest again, in the general direction of Zolotonosha, Cherkasy Oblast.

It looks like Maduro may have negotiated a surrender with the US, with him and his wife being airlifted out by Delta Force, allowing Trump to achieve a major propaganda victory. 
Venezuela's military wouldn't have been able to put up meaningful resistance against the US. Some sort of stand down order was given once the airstrikes began, as there was literally zero resistance, not even a shot fired at the helicopters flying incredibly low.

Changes on the frontline in Ukraine for December 2025:
Yellow = Russian advances
Light blue = Ukrainian advances
Russian advances:
Donetsk Oblast: ~300.32 km¬≤
Zaporizhzhia Oblast: ~173.59 km¬≤
Kharkiv Oblast: ~63.33 km¬≤
Sumy Oblast: ~38.98 km¬≤
Dnipropetrovsk Oblast: ~36.42 km¬≤
Luhansk Oblast: ~10.11 km¬≤
Belgorod Oblast: ~1.76 km¬≤
Total: ~624.51 km¬≤ (down by 23.87%)
Total (excluding Kursk & Belgorod): ~622.75 km¬≤
Ukrainian advances:
Kharkiv Oblast: ~50.57 km¬≤
Dnipropetrovsk Oblast: ~20.54 km¬≤
Zaporizhzhia Oblast: ~10.20 km¬≤ 
Donetsk Oblast: ~9.15 km¬≤
Total: ~90.46 km¬≤ (down by 5.79%).
Note: This covers net gains for each side. Ukrainian advances that took place on territory Russia occupied within this month will simply be subtracted from the Russian total, and vice versa.

Maduro Mobilizes Venezuelan Army As U.S. Helicopters Attack Key HQ In Caracas (Videos)
President Nicol√°s Maduro signed a state of emergency and ordered all national defense plans to be implemented ‚Äúat the appropriate time and under the appropriate circumstances,‚Äù the Venezuelan government announced in a statement issued on January 3 morning, just a few hours after the beginning of an attack on the country by the United States.
U.S. officials confirmed to CBS News that Trump ordered strikes on sites inside Venezuela, including military facilities, without providing any additional details.
Other officials told CNN later that the U.S. Senate Armed Services Committee was not notified by the Trump administration ahead of the strikes.
Videos posted online indicate that many military sites in Caracas were hit, with evidence suggesting multiple air defense systems were destroyed and reports saying that the residency of the country‚Äôs defense minister, Vladimir Padrino L√≥pez, was targeted.

Trump Says U.S. Forces Captured Venezuela's Maduro In 'Large Scale Strike'
President Donald Trump announced on January 3 that the United States carried out a ‚Äúlarge scale strike against Venezuela‚Äù and that President Nicolas Maduro and his wife have been captured and removed from the country.
Venezuelan Defense Minister Vladimir Padrino L√≥pez appeared after Trump‚Äôs announcement, and said in a video message that the country is currently gathering information about the number of people killed and wounded.
While treason may have played a key role in the success of the U.S. strike, a report by Sky News suggested that the capture of Maduro was in fact the result of an understanding between him and Trump.
Read more 
HERE

Pro-Iran Hackers Breached Phone Of Former Israeli Interior Minister (Photos)
The pro-Iran Handala hacking group announced on January 3 that it had hacked the phone of former Israeli interior and justice minister Ayelet Shaked.
‚ÄúFor years, Shaked stood on podiums, preaching security, authority, and the fight against her enemies. But now, her messages, documents, and confidential information about Hamas, Iran, and behind-the-scenes decisions are in our hands,‚Äù Handala claimed on X. ‚ÄúStay tuned; parts of what we have uncovered will soon be released, so everyone will know.‚Äù
The hacking group shared some 60 photos and videos it said were stolen from the phone of the former right-wing minister.
Many of the materials shared by the group were personal, but some were related to the work of Shake, including several photos showing Shaked signing Justice Ministry documents and meeting with former prime minister Naftali Bennett in a government office.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Is About To Overrun Ukrainian Defenses Between Slovyansk And Kostiantynivka (Videos)
On January 3, Russian military operations to the east of the city of Kostiantynivka in Donetsk began to gain momentum with the capture of a settlement.
Bondarnoye, located 28 kilometers away from Kostiantynivka, was captured by the Yug [South] Group of Forces, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense. The capture of the settlement enhanced fire control over the E40 highway, located to the west, which leads north to the city of Slovyansk.
The Yug Group of Forces also made gains to the west of the E40 in recent days, mainly in and around Markove.
Read more 
HERE
